comment: It probably works on many devices, but on my LIFETAB S7866 running Android 4.4.4, the headset volume continues to be limited to 50% even if I set it to 100% using this app.

title: Not more advise
comment: It work perfect. Take all the sec you lose try to up the sound and cut the annoying messenger.

title: Was what I was looking for
comment: I don't understand how this feature isn't already part of the Android system. It helps me enjoy my music without messing up my ears with notifications. I have noticed that recently, my phone freezes (sometimes crashing) when I plug in or pull out my headphones, and when I change the volume manually. I uninstalled this program for a while to test, and it seems like the one causing the problem. I still use it since it's a great program, but I wish that could be fixed.

title: Finally!!
comment: If I only knew this piece of Dimond existed any sooner my level of inner happiness the last couple of years would have increased by the millions.

title: Virtually fixes the automatic volume adjusting
comment: I don't know if anybody's noticed, but Android automatic volume adjusting is "bad word" annoying! So, when I connect to my car using the auxiliary cord, it is constantly lowering the volume back down, making the trip dangerous, as I try to increase the volume again, and again. This isn't perfect, but it does a lot to fix that.

title: Didn't work
comment: On my note 3 it didn't fix the annoying volume warning when I connect to Bluetooth

title: You are a godsend!
comment: I found your app looking for a solution to the volume hijack on my Samsung tablet when I plug in my portable speaker for my sleep sounds and every so often thereafter. Been waking up poorly because it turns my sounds down so far I can't hear them over my fan. Bye bye nanny! Now if it were only possible to port this app to fix the same issue on Windows phone (even on bluetooth speakers). I would even pay for it. Hey phone OS makers, we don't all use headphones (I hate them) and we aren't all idiots. Stop playing nanny to save them from themselves and giving us half functional devices. At least if they make themselves deaf, we won't have to hear their stupidity. Win-win.

title: Needs 1 more thing
comment: Need an option to remove the Samsung volume nanny.

title: Omg, Yes!!!!
comment: Thank you very much for this amazing app! Tried using Tasker to set my max volume to 15 when headphone is plugged in, but had no luck. This app, however, worked flawlessly! Love it!!! 😍

title: Works
comment: The only method I know of for getting rid of volume warning. I use my phone through my car stereo through Bluetooth so it needs to be at the highest level (I adjust via car stereo knob). I hated having to hit ok every time I want to raise it. This app finally solved the problem after trying several fixes from the forums.

title: Control your volume
comment: Easy and effective workaround for Android setting the volume to 60% whenever headphones are plugged in. I no longer have to manually raise the volume every time I plug my phone in to my car's aux cable.

title: Brilliant.
comment: Got rid of the annoying volume warning on galaxy s5. Lovely jubbly.

title: Thank you!
comment: This app is amazing! I can no longer use Xposed because Samsung had to make a custom library for ART. This is a good non-root workaround for the annoying high volume nag! You're awesome!

title: Exactly what I needed!
comment: 2015, running lollipop on a note 4 and I cant believe this is not part of the OS! It feels stupid to have such an expensive phone running the latest OS version and I still have to fill it up with little apps to compensate the missing features that should already be standard. And I still wonder why 3Gb of RAM are still not enough for a phone these days to run smooth. Well because it's stuffed with tones of apps that should be standard by now.

title: 4 star because
comment: Actually this app is amazing.. But like Facebook this app should work in backroom.. When I make ram clean,this app stops running in background.. Again need to enable.. So please developer needs to see..
This is awesome, thanks to the developer for such awesomeness

title: Thank YOU so much
comment: Nothing more annoying than somebody giving me features then making them inconvenient to use. This program solved the mommy settings of volume reducing when plugging into the DAC output. Wonderfully happy my docking works without extra taping and sliding.

comment: I'm using this app to destroy my hearing. Thank you so much, now I can stop being late to work.
Loving it

title: Problem solved

title: Got rid of warning
comment: This app is awesome and is the easy way instead of rooting your phone to get rid of the annoying warning of turning the volume up when Aux is plugged in.

comment: Great app works 100%, now media volume at 100% may thanks to developer hope it works when new lollipop 5 arrives for note 4.

title: Ronseal
comment: Saves you those two seconds or so of annoyance...

title: This is definitely one of my favorite apps!
comment: Fixed that annoying warning message on my Note 4!!

title: Volume.
comment: Thank you, it works. I thought this was going to be a real problem but, now I can enjoy music how I want to.

I love that this app keeps my volume set how I like it in spite of the "nanny" settings built into phones these days. I'm half deaf - I don't need a company turning my music down so I can't hear it just because someone decided that they weren't responsible enough to control their own volume...

title: Gets rid of the nanny volume checker thing
comment: As well as being a pretty useful app for not exploding your eardrums unexpectedly when plugging in headphones it also gets rid of the annoying "are you sure you want to raise the volume, you might damage your frail delicate hearing" warning. Simple and effective app.
Helped a lot because my volume buttons are broken and i can't somehow bypass the sound limiter.
No special use requests!  This app is the cat's meow! Gets rid of the nanny hearing warning.
Causes volume indicator to be unresponsive

title: Exactly what I was looking for
comment: Was looking for the ability to automatically mute the ringer when the handset was unplugged (and enable the ringer when handset plugged in), and this app does that and more.  Works perfectly on a Samsung Epic 4G (SPH-D700) running CM11.  Thanks!

title: Fixed my volume issues
comment: My volume buttons are broken, and while other apps widgets were an okay workaround for the most part, inserting headphones would set the media volume to 7/15, and not allowing to go higher. Thanks to this, I can listen to music and podcasts at the volume I want. Thanks Hearing Saver!

title: Should have been a part of Android
comment: I find the features of this app a necessity... Saving and restoring volume levels across headphone plugs / unplugs, including Bluetooth.  Android should have offered such a feature.
Good simple app, if it changes the alarm it be perfect.

title: No more loud volume warning!
comment: Works for BT audio and headphones, no more annoying Loud Volume warning messages on my rooted Note 4!

title: Neat little app
comment: Overall concept of the app is good but did not fix the issue with the "protect your ears" feature that is embedded in the Android system on my LG G2. Thank you.
Small. Lightweight. Does what it does well. What more could you ask for. Cheers Jake.

title: Good at first...
comment: Now it doesn't work very often.
Perfect solution to a crap situation!  Nice one!

title: Huh?
comment: I have tried, and failed to find any benefit at all from anything this thing "does." It actually *adds* to the steps necessary to get volume where you need it. Baffling.

title: Wow!
comment: I've been suffering with impossibly low Netflix volume on my Nexus 4 for a year now.  The Android limiter made hearing the voices in movies impossible unless using Bluetooth 'phones.  Plug-in 'phones were simply too quiet.  I installed this app and immediately overcame that problem.  I had to unplug and plug in the 'phones once after starting Netflix, but I am impressed.  Thank you!

title: It has solved my frustrations
comment: My Nexus 7 and N 5 phone didn't work before ,the sound with external speakers had  very low volume,this great app has solved the issue Thanks to the talented soul for sharing it

title: Asus MemoPad 7
comment: Unfortunately doesn't get rid of the volume warning on my Asus MemoPad 7 running 4.2.2  After tapping OK to clear the warning, the volume is then restored by Hearing Saver. Not the dev's fault without checking every device out there, so difficult to rate.

title: Fixed hearing protection issue
comment: Can't stress enough how annoying the automatic volume decreaser built into the phone. This app fixed that. Thanks for creating!

title: Set and forget
comment: Uses minimal processing power, Great override for kit Kat volume safety feature. Don't forget to restart the phone for changes to take effect!  LG G2

title: Another Joke.
comment: This app is typical of Samsung and Android RUBBISH. I was so excited when I bought my Galaxy Note 2, 18 months ago, and joined the Android community. I thought great, but after a few months I thought what a bloody waste of time and money. Android OS and Android apps are RUBBISH. Especially apps that are available on iTunes and Play Store, on Android they're always CRAP. THIS APP HAS NO AFFECT ON MY GALAXY NOTE 2 WHAT SO EVER, uninstalled.

title: Solved volume issue with Netflix on Nexus 7
comment: Volume with Netflix on the Nexus 7 was so low you could hardly hear it. This app fixed that totally. Thanks

title: Works as advertised on my Nexus 5 with Kit Kat 4.4.4r2
comment: Nice little lightweight app with a simple set-and-forget interface that overcomes Android's annoying volume restriction message.  I use expensive high impedance earphones and even with the player at full volume they aren't all that loud.  This saved me from having to "OK" every time I wanted to turn the volume up.  PROVISO: The app doesn't do it's thing after a phone reboot so you have to OK the volume increase; but just the once, until the phone is turned completely off again (Airplane Mode doesn't cause a problem).  For that reason I can't give it 5 stars... but 4 seems somehow stingy for a free app that helped me.  So, thank you, Jake Basile!

title: Thank you sir
comment: Best way to fix bs volume warnings without root! I give one million stars!

title: Does nothing
comment: Trying to get rid of the annoying volume warning on my Nexus 5 every time I plug in headphones.  Was told this app would override that warning.  Does nothing of the sort.  Useless.

title: Just Great!
comment: I thought my ear-phones were incompatible with my new N7 2013, until I found this app. I can now actually hear my music! Many thanks.

title: Doesn't remove warning message
comment: Having tested after a reboot, the volume warning message still displays (kitkat Galaxy Nore 3) and only restores the volume after the message is cleared. Shame.

title: BINGO!
comment: All I wanted was an app that bypasses the annoying  "hearing protection" warning on KitKat. This app does that (and more if you want).

title: It works!
comment: Thank you for creating an app that does this. Without it I would not be able to use my phone properly. My volume key broke and I was unable to increase the volume sufficiently without this app.

comment: More improve.

title: You shouldn't use cans without it
comment: The summary says it all.

title: Volume sliders are too different from system sliders
comment: It's very difficult to set the ringer volume to the lowest audible setting. I'm on stock 4.2.1 and my system volumes have a slider where the lowest value is vibrate. In Hearing Saver, a large chunk of the lowest part of the slider is vibrate and it took a lot of trial and error to set the lowest volume that hasn't disabled the ringer. It would be great if all the way down was vibrate and anything slightly above it was audible -- or if the sliders were the same as the system ones (not sure if that's possible).  Or it could be nice to just apply the "Save last volume" to all plugged. (So I can use the phone's media and ringtone volume control to set the plugged and unplugged volumes.)  Aside from that, it's great to stop the deafening notification sounds when I use headphones. The "Save last pluggedvolume" feature is awesome.
Works

comment: Best app around to overide the ghastly volume limitet on andoid phones and tablets.

title: C
comment: Stops European crap laws on sound

title: Amazing.
comment: Perfect app!!! This made me happy to find. Awesome!!!!

title: Good example of empowerment
comment: Thank you.  A simple fix to a nanny state trying to turn my volume down.

title: Perfect!
comment: Gets rid of the annoying volume warning on the Nexus 5! :-)

title: It overrides the annoying Hearing Protection
comment: I cannot express how I hated being dictated by Jelly Bean warning me about the risk of hearing damage if listening loud volume AND reseting my volume to factory level every single time after I unplugged and replugged back my headphones. I appreciate the warning the first time, but not every single time I use the headphones. I've been searching for an app like this for a long time. I'm not quite a tech guru to do all of the rooting or whatever they call it to modify the phone, but I can install Hearing Saver with ease. Thank you not because you saved my hearing but for saving my head from exploding. Of course for someone who likes to listen to music soft or at any given volume level that they like, Hearing Saver would be able to help you as well. 2 thumbs up!!!!!

title: Works great to override existing hearing protection
comment: I have this functionality built into my LG G2 with no way to turn it off. If I plug in to headphone jack it is usually to car stereo or speakers and rarely ever heaphones (I use Bluetooth for that). So I am using it for the opposite reason to max volume when plugging into the headphone jack to counteract the built in software that wants to turn it down.
Love this app

title: Sanity Saver
comment: DO NOT CHANGE A THING about this app.  If you're going to have an "auto volume adjustment" (looking at you LG) on your phone, at least let me have a way to disable it.  I'm smart, I know that hot coffee burns and volumes at max damage my ears.  For all of those out there with half a brain who get sick and tired of plugging your phone into your car or home stereo and then having to turn up the volume on your phone after it turned itself down to "protect your ears", THIS IS THE APP FOR YOU!  Works great, I plug my cord in LG tells me loud volumes can damage my ears, this app turns the volume to max, or wherever you set it really.  You're so thoughtful LG, maybe you should think about protecting users bodies against broken glass and steering wheels when they've gotten in an accident for having to screw around with the volume on there phone!!!
